CDUSignalDeassertedEPOAlarm.Description: The CDU_OK signal from the CEC to the CMM wasn't detected for several consecutive checks and so cabinet power was removed and the EPO bits were set.
CDUSignalDeassertedEPOAlarm.Message: The CDU_OK signal from the CEC to the CMM was deasserted so an EPO was initated.
CDUSignalDeassertedEPOAlarm.Resolution: Check the connection to the CEC, then check the CEC for any abnormal conditions that may result in an EPO. After the underying issue is fixed, issue a redfish ForceOff to this and all cabinets in the cooling group to clear the EPO.

EPOAlarmCleared.Description: The EPO has been cleared by issuing a ForceOff request to all of the CMMs in the cooling group. If the underlying issue has not been resolved, the system will revert back into an EPO state.
EPOAlarmCleared.Message: The EPO condition has been cleared via Redfish.

ManualEPOAlarm.Description: The CEC initiated an EPO via a connected CMM using redfish.
ManualEPOAlarm.Message: An EPO was manually triggered by a user.
ManualEPOAlarm.Resolution: Issue a redfish ForceOff to this and all cabinets in the cooling group to clear the EPO, then send a power request.

RectifierAcDistortion.Description: AC power distortion has been potentially detected by the rectifier.
RectifierAcDistortion.Message: The rectifier has detected a potential AC distortion.
RectifierAcDistortion.Resolution: Please examine, and if needed, replace the rectifier especially if it is making an audible noise.

RectifierAcDistortionCleared.Description: AC power distortion no longer detected by the rectifier.

RectifierAcOutOfRange.Description: AC power input out of range detected by rectifier.
RectifierAcOutOfRange.Message: Rectifier has detected AC input out of range.
RectifierAcOutOfRange.Resolution: Examine system power input and PDU breakers/fuses.

RectifierAcOutOfRangeCleared.Description: AC power input out of range no longer detected by rectifier.
RectifierAcOutOfRangeCleared.Message: Rectifier no longer detects AC input out of range.

RectifierCommunicationFailure.Description: The rectifier is not responding. This error implies that rectifier is experiencing communcation issues.
RectifierCommunicationFailure.Message: The rectifier is not communicating with chassis controller.
RectifierCommunicationFailure.Resolution: Please examine, and if needed, replace the rectifier on this shelf.

RectifierCommunicationFailureCleared.Message: The rectifier is now able to communicate with chassis controller.

RectifierFailure.Description: The rectifer has failed, but the shelf has N+1 rectifer redundancy to enable continuous operation.
RectifierFailure.Message: A rectifier has failed and is reporting a status register value: %1

RectifierFailureCleared.Description: The rectifier is now operating normally.
RectifierFailureCleared.Message: The rectifier is now operating normally.

RectifierHighVoltageShutdown.Description: High voltage conditions have caused the rectifier to shutdown.
RectifierHighVoltageShutdown.Message: Rectifier shutdown due to high voltage.
RectifierHighVoltageShutdown.Resolution: Please examine, and if needed, replace the rectifier on this shelf.

RectifierHighVoltageShutdownCleared.Description: The rectifier is no longer observing high voltage conditions.
RectifierHighVoltageShutdownCleared.Message: Rectifier no longer shutdown due to high voltage.

RectifierLoadshareImbalance.Description: Rectifier power imbalanced detected in multiple parallel loadsharing units.
RectifierLoadshareImbalance.Resolution: Please examine, and if needed, replace the rectifier on this shelf.

RectifierLoadshareImbalanceCleared.Description: Rectifier power imbalanced no longer detected in multiple parallel loadsharing units.
RectifierLoadshareImbalanceCleared.Message: Rectifier power loadshare imbalance no longer detected.

RectifierLowInputVoltage.Description: Input voltage to rectifier is lower than the threshold.
RectifierLowInputVoltage.Message: Rectifier has detected low input voltage.

RectifierLowInputVoltageCleared.Description: Input voltage to rectifier is no longer low.
RectifierLowInputVoltageCleared.Message: Rectifier no longer detects low input voltage.

RectifierOpenInterlock.Description: The rectifier is off due to the state of the interlock or enable input signals.
RectifierOpenInterlock.Message: Rectifier interlock is open or enable is off.
RectifierOpenInterlock.Resolution: Check that the ejector handle is closed and latched. Verify ENABLE state.

RectifierOpenInterlockCleared.Description: The rectifier interlock is closed and enable is on, allowing power on.
RectifierOpenInterlockCleared.Message: Rectifier interlock is closed or enable is on.

RectifierOringFetFailure.Description: The rectifier is reporting that its ORing FET power component has failed.
RectifierOringFetFailure.Message: The rectifier ORing FET has failed.
RectifierOringFetFailure.Resolution: Please examine, and if needed, replace the rectifier on this shelf.

RectifierOringFetFailureCleared.Description: The rectifier is reporting that the ORing FET has returned to normal operation.
RectifierOringFetFailureCleared.Message: The rectifier ORing FET failure has cleared.

RectifierPowerLimited.Description: The rectifier is power limited. This error implies that one of the other (redundant) power supply has failed.
RectifierPowerLimited.Message: The rectifier is not able to supply the amount of power being requested.
RectifierPowerLimited.Resolution: Please examine and if needed replace the other rectifiers on this shelf.

RectifierPowerLimitedCleared.Description: The rectifier is now able to meet power requirements.
RectifierPowerLimitedCleared.Message: The rectifier is now able to meet power requirements.

RectifierThermalShutdown.Description: The rectifier has exceeded the maximum safe operating temperature and was powered down.
RectifierThermalShutdown.Message: The rectifier has exceeded the maximum safe operating temperature and was powered down.
RectifierThermalShutdown.Resolution: Verify that the coolant hoses are properly seated.

RectifierThermalShutdownCleared.Description: The rectifier is now within an allowable operating temperature and able to power on.
RectifierThermalShutdownCleared.Message: The rectifier is now within an allowable operating temperature and able to power on.

RectifierVoltageOutputUnbalanced.Description: One of the 380v rectifier output lines is shorted to ground.
RectifierVoltageOutputUnbalanced.Message: One of the 380v rectifier output lines is shorted to ground.
RectifierVoltageOutputUnbalanced.Resolution: Power down the shelf and remove blades one at a time till the rectifier no longer shows an imbalance, then investigate the problematic blade.

RectifierVoltageOutputUnbalancedCleared.Description: The rectifier output voltage is now balanced. This indicates that both voltage output lines have similar voltage difference to ground.
RectifierVoltageOutputUnbalancedCleared.Message: The rectifier output voltage is now balanced.

Name: HPE CMM Alarms Message Registry
